content: Hi, everyone! On the online rustdoc for rustc, I find both LocalDefId's and DefId's implementations (i.e., methods on the sidebar) and field implementations are possibly missing. By clicking the source code button (LocalDefId's source and DefId's source), we can find they actually have some implementations and field implementations. Is there any specific reasons why this happen?
The traits nor their implementations are marked as doc(hidden) so my best guess from a very quick check is that it's a bug

It's a bug with cross-crate re-exports. I've noticed it before. There may even be an open issue.

For example, https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/nightly-rustc/rustc_span/def_id/struct.DefId.html has the methods because it's the original definition not the re-export
